cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi W of Cabo Cruz, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across central Cuba, then turning north-northwest through the Florida Straits and up the eastern Gulf toward Florida’s west coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida coast (near Cedar Key / Big Bend area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Florida Keys from east of Craig Key to Ocean Reef, Florida Bay, and the west coast of Florida from Flamingo northward to the Anclote River
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Keys from Craig Key westward to the Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, south and west coasts of the Florida Peninsula, and portions of south-east Florida
weather_observation.wind: Squalls with sustained winds generally 25-35 mph and occasional gusts 40 mph Monday night–Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge 1-2 ft possible mainly in Biscayne Bay; negligible in main harbor channels
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain 2-4 inches; isolated totals to 6 inches could trigger brief ponding/flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Monday afternoon–night; hazardous seas and rip currents affecting pilot boarding areas
